div.span: From Sunday, March 15, 2020 through the end of the school year, WRSD will be conducting educational programming via a remote learning model. The buildings are closed to all unless authorized by the superintendent of schools.
to see updates, communication, food related, and remote learning resources

div.div: Engaging Our Community For Brighter Futures

br.span: Children who will be 5 years old on or before September 30, 2020 are eligible to register for Kindergarten. Click here for details

span.typing-node: Remote learning is underway. To access updates and resources for students, parents, and teachers as we move through this remote learning experience please Click Here.

div.span: Statewide Assessment Exemption Notification Letter for Parents

span.div: Each year, students in grades 3 through 8 participate in the New Hampshire Statewide Assessment System (NH SAS), and students in grade 11 participate in the College Board School Day SAT and NH SAS science assessment. Students who have the most significant cognitive disabilities are eligible to take the Dynamic Learning Maps (DLM) Assessment, as designed in their active individualized education program (IEP).
Click the link below to go to the Long Range Planning Committee Website.
To learn more about the exciting activities going on in our district and community, please check out our monthly State of the District Newsletter.

For past issues click here
Robert Seaward
Superintendent of Schools

div.span: Watch WRSD School Board meetings LIVE

span.div: You can watch the WRSD School Board meetings live online through Livestream.
When a meeting is in progress it will show “live now.” When we have a few meetings recorded they will show up on the right side of the Livestream screen with meeting dates. NO login is required.

a.title: This meeint will start at 9am in the High School Gymnasium. Starting at: 9:00 AM

td.a: 1/2 Day of School - Teacher Workshop Day

a.title: Location: SCS Library Starting at: 5:30 PM Ending at: 6:30 PM
